New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2024 年 1 月 17 日星期三 08:14:02 +0000 zh 1每小时1
Hot, muggy weather for Auckland, rain warning for South Island’s West Coast https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/weather-daily-lows-in-auckland-unlikely-to-dip-below-20c-until-tuesday-south-islands-west-coast-braces-for-倾盆大雨/ENNEBBU6VFBL3HBQEGJ65VYEDQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/weather-daily-lows-in-auckland-unlikely-to-dip-below-20c-until-tuesday-south-islands-west-coast-braces-for-倾盆大雨/ENNEBBU6VFBL3HBQEGJ65VYEDQ/ Raphael Franks, Benjamin PlummerMuch of the country set for humid conditions over the coming days. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 07:47:17 +0000 Hot temperatures and showers will plague Auckland well into next week, with daily lows in the city unlikely to dip below 20C. Photo / Alex Burton
Loaded gun in car means Mongrel Mob president Joseph Johnson must stay in jail https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/loaded-gun-in-car-means-mongrel-mob-president-joseph-johnson-must-stay-in-jail/GH64K57YGVA2NE6OVEMS5XGMWI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/loaded-gun-in-car-means-mongrel-mob-president-joseph-johnson-must-stay-in-jail/GH64K57YGVA2NE6OVEMS5XGMWI/ Ric StevensHe says he took the gun off someone else because he was 'concerned about public safety'. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 07:00:00 +0000 Mongrel Mob leader Joseph William Johnson has been unsuccessful in appealing his sentence of imprisonment.
One dead after car and motorcycle collide on SH60, west of Nelson https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/one-dead-after-car-and-motorcycle-collide-on-sh60-west-of-nelson/EZ22CYM2SBHVXBDEZ2SZ2I4VYQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/one-dead-after-car-and-motorcycle-collide-on-sh60-west-of-nelson/EZ22CYM2SBHVXBDEZ2SZ2I4VYQ/ Road remains closed while Serious Crash Unit conducts a scene examination. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 06:27:03 +0000 The road remains closed while the Serious Crash Unit conducts a scene examination. Photo / Bevan Conley
Auckland Business Chamber CEO Simon Bridges in hospital with broken wrist after electric scooter accident https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-business-chamber-ceo-simon-bridges-in-hospital-with-broken-wrist-after-electric-scooter-accident/IFIUV7HVYZEFLEE7O52IF5KW4Q/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-business-chamber-ceo-simon-bridges-in-hospital-with-broken-wrist-after-electric-scooter-accident/IFIUV7HVYZEFLEE7O52IF5KW4Q/ Benjamin PlummerBridges said he had broken his wrist and badly grazed his face. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 06:09:39 +0000 Simon Bridges, former leader of the National Party and now CEO of Auckland Business Chamber, in Auckland Hospital after falling from an electric scooter. Photo / Supplied
NCEA results error leaves Tauranga student worried about university chances https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ncea-results-error-leaves-tauranga-student-worried-about-university-chances/QPPUAJSPTNE6XM4K5BIBOMJ7QY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ncea-results-error-leaves-tauranga-student-worried-about-university-chances/QPPUAJSPTNE6XM4K5BIBOMJ7QY/ Rachel MaherHe has already been told he might have to add extra time to his degree due to the error. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 06:05:55 +0000 NZQA said their investigation into the error will take at least a week, but the student only has two days to get into university. Photo / 123RF
Waikato man Roger ‘living man’ Blake jailed for selling bleach as cure for Covid-19 https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/waikato-man-roger-living-man-blake-jailed-for- sell-bleach-as-cure-for-covid-19/PR4Q45A7YBHTRFFODYNFBFVTFY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/waikato-man-roger-living-man-blake-jailed-for- sell-bleach-as-cure-for-covid-19/PR4Q45A7YBHTRFFODYNFBFVTFY/ Belinda FeekRoger Blake's company made more than $100,000 selling the product during the pandemic. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 06:00:00 +0000 Ngatea man Roger "living man" Blake, pictured in 2011, has been sent to jail after being found guilty of 29 charges under the Medicines Act. Photo / Elaine Fisher
Tenant left cockroach infestation, damage and $12k in rent arrears at Auckland house https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tenant-left-cockroach-infestation-damage-and-12k-in-rent-arrears-at-auckland-house/Z2ASVZLO6NCHNLPDLGH4XUU7EI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tenant-left-cockroach-infestation-damage-and-12k-in-rent-arrears-at-auckland-house/Z2ASVZLO6NCHNLPDLGH4XUU7EI/ Natalie AkoorieA tenant owes more than $10k to ex-landlord for rent arrears, damage and rubbish clean-up. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 05:00:00 +0000 A tenant left a house unclean, with rubbish and unmown lawns. The property manager also found a cockroach infestation like the one pictured and had to call pest control on behalf of the landlord. Photo / Greg Bowker
Kiwi disaster relief team in Vanuatu to help assess cyclone-damaged schools https://www.nzherald.co.nz/talanoa/kiwi-disaster-relief-team-in-vanuatu-to-help-assess-cyclone-damaging-schools/2GVTILQ4ZBAPTGCRIGOXZWUQLM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/talanoa/kiwi-disaster-relief-team-in-vanuatu-to-help-assess-cyclone-damaging-schools/2GVTILQ4ZBAPTGCRIGOXZWUQLM/ Vaimoana MaseThree months after Tropical Cyclone Lola, dozens of schools remain uninhabitable. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 04:15:00 +0000 Dozens of schools and education facilities around Vanuatu were severely damaged during Tropical Cyclone Lola last October. Photo / Andrew Gray
Police charge former Green MP Golriz Ghahraman over shoplifting allegations https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-charge-former-green-mp-golriz-ghahraman-over-shoplifting-allegations/2GVYVW65IVG4VAN2SVGUW6GAXU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-charge-former-green-mp-golriz-ghahraman-over-shoplifting-allegations/2GVYVW65IVG4VAN2SVGUW6GAXU/ Golriz Ghahraman is facing two shoplifting charges over two December incidents. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 04:13:31 +0000 Former Green MP Golriz Ghahraman. Photo / Garth Badger
Grass fire in Twizel: Eighteen fire crews, four helicopters battle 5ha blaze https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/grass-fire-in-twizel-eighteen-fire-crews-four-helicopters-battle-5ha-blaze/2HEGLLJ6OZAIFM22V3UAEXRNFU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/grass-fire-in-twizel-eighteen-fire-crews-four-helicopters-battle-5ha-blaze/2HEGLLJ6OZAIFM22V3UAEXRNFU/ Fire and Emergency NZ first alerted to the fire at 3.42 and crews arrived 10 min later. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 04:08:53 +0000 A Fire and Emergency New Zealand spokeswoman said a blaze near Twizel was first reported to them at 3.42pm. The first crews arrived from Twizel 10 minutes later. Photo / File, Bevan Conley
